unit_learning_outcomes.description: Demonstrate a basic understanding and appreciation of theory and typical research findings relating to cause and maintenance of the psychological disorders covered in this unit.
Demonstrate an understanding of the multiple definitions of abnormal behaviour and how to assess it.
Demonstrate awareness of the prevalence and demographics typical for the psychological disorders covered in this unit.
Display communication and critical analysis skills: in particular, analyse the theoretical and empirical literature and professionally communicate research findings.
Identify the signs, symptoms and science-based treatments of the psychological disorders covered in this unit.

enrolment_rules.description: 20cp from PSY or PSYC or PSYU or PSYX units at 2000 level including PSY248 or PSYU2248 or PSYX248 or PSYX2248

assessments.description: Final examination held within the University’s formal exam period, in accordance with relevant requirements.
Three online multiple-choice quizzes testing unit content.
A 1500 word written report, in APA format, that diagnosis a case vignette, and uses a science-based theory to describe the case’s condition and recommended treatment.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This online unit focuses on so-called abnormal behaviour. Following a general introduction to the nature and study of abnormality, each of the main forms of psychopathology are discussed, along with theories of psychopathology and their evidence (when available), as well as science-based interventions. Tutorials are face-to-face and run fortnightly. An intermediate level of research methodology and statistical knowledge is a pre-requisite for this unit, as this knowledge is required to understand the scientific basis of psychopathology and its theories.
data.title: Psychopathology
